intro: Hieracium comatum var. filipense, commonly known as the Philippine hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and yellowish to reddish flower heads. The plant typically has basal leaves that are lanceolate and covered in fine hairs. It thrives in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas. Due to its invasive potential, it is often found in areas where it can outcompete native vegetation.
